results.description:
Nectar is a talk-free dance inspired by conscious and ecstatic dance. It is a space to enjoy and explore embodiment, physical expression, and the body’s wisdom. After an unguided warm-up period, the Facilitator-DJ leads a brief opening circle on a theme or guided practice, followed by a playlist of music—beginning spacious and mellow, gaining intensity, and arriving back into stillness. Participants are welcome to move, dance, and be still as their bodies desire. Nectar closes with a sharing circle in which participants are welcome to speak about their experiences in the dance.

Nectar is offered primarily for adults. Children are welcome with adult accompaniment provided they can follow the talk-free and intentional structure and be mindful of their impact on others in the space. Kids under 6 can come for free, and ages 6-12 for half price ($5-7). $10-15 for adults.

Nectar was created by Amorn O’Connor and Harrison Blum, and is supported by a rotating crew of Facilitator-DJs.

Please note that many more people attend than RSVP via Meetup!

results.description:
IT'S BACK TO PUG TIME AT THE  PUG SUNDAY MEETUP!


Let's all hope for cooler weather, because it's not just back to school time, it's back to Pug time!  Please join us at Assistant Organizer Sharon's home in Carver - where Millie, and Max and the latest addition, little Griswold the unPug, hang out. This is our favorite location - a quiet, rural side street with plenty of parking, a HUGE fenced yard, plenty of chairs, and lots and lots of flat grassy green space to run and run and run!

Remember that your host provides the soft drinks and paperware for each meetup, but we count on our members to bring the snacks. Feel free to bring snacks for the Pugs, but try to bring soft snacks so that Clovis can have some too! If you are coming to your first meetup, please be sure to let us know, so we can introduce you to everyone and make you and your Puggies feel welcome!

WOULD YOU LIKE TO HOST A MEETUP?

Please let your organizer know!

We are very fortunate to have Sharon host most of our fair weather meetups during the course of the year, with occasional help from myself, but we are always delighted to change the venue when someone else wants to host a meetup.  We are looking for folks to host meetups on either Saturday or Sunday!

We're hoping that the folks who have hosted before will be able will step in and host a social or two in during the year. For those who haven't hosted before, but would like to try, and if you do have a fenced yard large enough to accommodate anywhere from 20 to 40 Puggies and a few assorted other small breeds, please let your organizer know. We would like to give everyone a chance to host who would like to host! It's fun!

ABOUT THE MEETUPS

We're all responsible Pug owners here, so don't be concerned about your babies. Wherever we meet, we'll make sure to have shade and plenty of water for keeping Pugs cool. There will be soft drinks and something to snack on for the people attending! If you bring treats for the Pugs, please ONLY hand out treats around the central table where everyone can keep an eye on the dogs, DON'T FEED CLOVIS, and PLEASE BE SURE that nothing gets dropped - your organizer has a Pug (yes, that would be Clovis...) who has brain damage which makes it very difficult for him to swallow. I don't want Clovis to choke to death on a stolen treat, and I'm sure no one else does either.. Thank you for your consideration!

Other small dogs are welcome, but please ask in advance if you can bring dogs other than Pugs. If you have a little Puggie roughneck on your hands, you can bring him too - but be prepared to keep an eye on him. If he starts bullying or being too rough with another dog, give him a time out until he can get himself under control. We want everyone to have fun!

Your organizers pay $89.94 twice a year in January and July for the privilege of organizing the South of Boston Pug Meetups, and believe me, it's worth every penny for the fun we have. If you would like to help defray the costs, please make a voluntary contribution of $1.00 to Charlotte Creeley each time you attend. Remember, it's VOLUNTARY - even if I had to pay twice as much, it would be worth it for the just to see the smile on Clovis's and Cletus's faces when the Puggie meetups roll around.
results.name: The South of Boston September Pug Sunday Meetup

Export

Norwell, MA">

lubdub Studio Norwell MA

179 Norwell Ave, Norwell, MA 02061, Norwell, MA (map)

++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

Drumming in the Feminine: 
Discover the ONLY Women's Ancient Drumming Tradition" ♡

*Saturday, September 19
Concert with Marla Leigh with Slide Show presentation , 7:30pm

*Sunday, September 20 
Frame Drum Workshop, 2-5pm

~ * ~ * ~ *~ * ~ * ~ *~ * ~ * ~ *~ * ~ * ~ *
*********************************************

Marla Leigh's East Coast Tour is starting here in Massachusetts on September 19 and 20. The concert is brought to you by Jan Hellew, Womyns Drumming Meetup, and BatucadaBelles.com, and Denise Rachael, thepianoworkshop.com, and Lubdubdrum.com. 

♡ Women were known as the first drummers!
As early as 5000 BCE, women were seen drumming in cultures worldwide playing a mystical instrument called the frame drum.

During ancient times, the frame drum was used for sacred ceremonies, rituals and rites of passages. Women’s spirituality, wisdom and sexuality were affirmed through rituals involving frame drumming.
. This special workshop immersion is designed to awaken and inspire the divine feminine through the ancient healing practices of frame drumming, traditional trance rhythms, chanting and meditation. 

Mental Health professional’s shows us that drumming reduces stress, anxiety and tension, and helps us experience being in resonance with the natural rhythms of life. Drumming enables a deep entrainment of the brain into states conductive to true healing. 

It is law of the universe that we actually accomplish and manifest way more by being in our grace, the essence of who we truly are. This is the place we attract what we need.

Experience the healing medicine, power and magic of frame drumming in a supportive community environment. 

Feel like you have NO drumming skills? 
Remember, we, as women, already know how to drum, as our ancestors practiced it thousands of years ago.

Join us for this extraordinary life changing experience

~ * ~ * ~ *~ * ~ * ~ *~ * ~ * ~ *~ * ~ * ~ *
*********************************************
♡ WORKSHOP INCLUDES
*Frame Drum “Her-story” 
*Frame Drum Playing strokes
*Mind Body Integration
*Hand & foot coordination (great to sharpen your brain)
*Traditional rhythms from around the world.
*Rhythmic vocalizing (Solkattu)
*Drum & sing Shamanic Medicine Songs & Healing Chants *Improvise & Create your own rhythms
*Basic Music Fundamentals
*DruMeditation Healing Rituals
*Fun community group drum jams
*Sound Healing practices using Frame Drums and Voice
*Handouts

SEPTEMBER 20 |2-5pm
$46 Pre REg (Before September 12) - 
$65 Thereafter

***SPECIAL PACKAGE DISCOUNT***
BOTH CONCERT & WORKSHOP FOR ONLY $58

~ * ~ * ~ *~ * ~ * ~ *~ * ~ * ~ *~ * ~ * ~ *


“THE MEDICINE DRUM CONCERT ”

Come experience the incredibly healing power and medicine of music

Dance, trance, and meditate to the ancient sounds of the sacred. Marla’s concerts combine ecstatic world music with meditation, ritual, & movement.

In these special celebrations of music, Marla plays an array of sacred percussion instruments mixed with flutes, chants and ambient electronics. Marla uses a looping-pedal to create a one women band – to create sonically healing mystical textures, rhythms and melodies.

A featured instrument of this concert will be the frame drum, which is one of the worlds oldest archetype of drums; A drum that was traditionally played by women for sacred ceremonies in ancient times.

 During this concert for the first time she will be showing a slide show from the "When the women were drummers"  collected by the author the late Lanyne Redmond.  We are excited to have this important women history slide show debute here for our community!

For those of you not familiar with Layne I have attached this awesome video.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8oOnwYrsWE0

Marla Leigh Goldstein is a Los Angeles based professional Percussionist, Flautist, Composer and Educator, and one of the very  few female specialists in the ancient Mediterranean frame drum.  She is an internationally recognized teacher and performer, who has presented throughout the USA, Canada and Europe. 

The next day Sunday , September 20 Marla will be leading a drum workshop.  All drums are welcome and her drumming style can be used on djembe, dumbeks, and DunDuns.  

Marla Leigh has agreed to do  two events for us at a  discounted price for the women's drum community we have.  This is available  under  the  earlybird special until Sept 12, 20195.

results.description:
There will be a $1 donation to Gabby to help pay for the meetup cost.

Rites of Passage by Joy Hensley

We will be meeting around Porter/Harvard area. If you have suggestions for a quiet bar, we are open.

Sam McKenna’s never turned down a dare. And she's not going to start with the last one her brother gave her before he died.

So Sam joins the first-ever class of girls at the prestigious Denmark Military Academy. She’s expecting push-ups and long runs, rope climbing and mud-crawling. As a military brat, she can handle an obstacle course just as well as the boys. She's even expecting the hostility she gets from some of the cadets who don’t think girls belong there. What she’s not expecting is her fiery attraction to her drill sergeant. But dating is strictly forbidden and Sam won't risk her future, or the dare, on something so petty... no matter how much she wants him.

As Sam struggles to prove herself, she discovers that some of the boys don’t just want her gone—they will stop at nothing to drive her out. When their petty threats turn to brutal hazing, bleeding into every corner of her life, she realizes they are not acting alone. A decades-old secret society is alive and active… and determined to force her out.

At any cost.

Now time's running short. Sam must decide who she can trust... and choosing the wrong person could have deadly consequences.

results.description:
***This meetup is restricted to people who have attended at least one discussion of the Knapsack meetup group in the last six months. (Most of our meetups count.)***

Each session includes time to: connect with each other, silently reflect and write about our anti-racism work, report on how we're doing regarding our anti-racism work, and receive feedback.  We usually do the reporting and feedback in small groups of 3-4 people.  If you can't stay as late as 4:30, please go ahead and RSVP, just let us know your limitations.

Remember to bring your notebook, if you have one!  (We'll have a few extra for anyone who hasn't come to an accountability session before.)

We have two options for the accountability session each month, hoping that those who want to join us will be able to go to one or the other.  You are welcome to attend both sessions, if you would like to do so. 


For more about our thoughts on these sessions, see "Open discussion to consider monthly accountability sessions."  Note: even if you don't claim to be doing anti-racism work, you can come to the session and see what it is about, as well as consider your own role. You still need to have met the requirement of having attended one of our discussion meetups within the last six months.


This is also a place where you can learn about and find an accountabilibuddy. 

Accessibility Information: Pappenheim Library at Community Change, Inc. is wheelchair accessible with the following limitations.  The door to the building is heavy and does not have a button to open it. The elevator doors are slightly more than 30 inches wide.  The sixth floor bathrooms are not wheelchair accessible, but the first floor bathroom is.  During regular hours there are usually two tables in the library which limit mobility, but these are normally moved elsewhere during Knapsack events.  Please let us know your needs so we can help make the event accessible for you.

results.description:
Hi all, sorry about the late post. Continuing on with our neighborhood series, let's sketch the Charlestown neighborhood. Charlestown is the oldest neighborhood in Boston.  It's home to many significant landmarks, including the Bunker Hill monument and the Charlestown Navy Yard, and Warren Tavern which has been in continuous operation since 1780. 

Once a home to a large Irish population, it now has a mix of young professionals and immigrants. With many colonial homes and views of downtown, this neighborhood is ideal for sketching.

We will meet at 2pm in front of the statue of William Prescott at the Bunker Hill monument, and then disperse. We will reconvene at 4pm outside of the momument to share our work and chat.


Looking forward to seeing you all!

The entrance to the gym is on Cambridge Street opposite Harvard Market. The nearest intersection to the entrance is Cambridge Street and Roberts Road. The nearest T stop is Harvard Square. The gym is about a ten minute walk from the T stop. Parking near the school on Sundays is generally easy to find, as meters and residential parking rules are generally not enforced on Sundays (parking signs should say "EX SUNDAY" or similar).
results.name: Cambridge High Intermediate (Yankee C/C-) Indoor Volleyball

results.description:
From 2 to 4 PM we will have an advanced level meetup at the Cambridge Recreational Center in Cambridge. There will be one court (12 spots) available. The game will be on a men's height net.

This game is for Yankee C+ and above level only (college club level or better). Players are required to know how to play a 6-2 and 5-1 formation.

If you'd like to play, please send an email to Brian using this URL: http://www.meetup.com/volleyball-122/message/?recipientId=4774008<a href="http://www.meetup.com/volleyball-122/message/?recipientId=4774008"></a>

In the email, confirm that you know how to play in a 5-1 or 6-2 offense, and mention your preferred position (if any).

Players will be added to the list to fill up positions. This game is intended for Yankee C+ and above players (or equivalent), and people who have not been no-shows at previous meetups. There is a strict cap to make sure everyone gets lots of playing time. Note that sending an email does not guarantee a spot to play; spots are only guaranteed if you receive a positive confirmation email. The cost of the meetup will be $5. Please pay the organizer when you arrive before the meetup starts. The money goes to cover the cost of the court rental. The entrance to the gym is on Cambridge Street opposite Harvard Market. The nearest intersection to the entrance is Cambridge Street and Roberts Road. The nearest T stop is Harvard Square. The gym is about a ten minute walk from the T stop. Parking near the school on Sundays is generally easy to find, as meters and residential parking rules are generally not enforced on Sundays (parking signs should say "EX SUNDAY" or similar).

results.description:
This group is for African and black singles in the Boston area who want to meet, network and possibly, establish friendships with others. It seeks to provide a variety of events that assist in building social and/or personal relationships

This group is for ages 30 to 60.
results.name: Welcome!

results.description:
We will be meeting at the Charles River on Soldiers Field Road. 

We'll start at 2 PM and we'll go till 4pm. Please bring a drum if you have one. We'll have a few available. Please bring your own folding chair and an extra if you have one. We cannot be responsible for the chairs.

Donations will be $10.-

Please RSVP so we know people are coming.

Besides your drum, we ask that you bring a folding chair. Sand chairs do not work well. Wear a hat. Bring some water with you. Restrooms may or may not be available.

Try to keep drumming to a minimum before Alan and the team shows up. We don't want to get kicked out!

What a fun day it's shaping up to be:)


Hope to see you there.

Alan, Fanta and Thierno

PS - If rain, we will postpone till following Sunday, same time.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be meeting at the Charles River PK Lot #4!
results.name: Drumming at the Charles!

results.description:
Come draw in one of the most surreal and creative shops around. It's a thrift store, cabinet of curiosities, vintage boutique, vinyl goldmine and art venue, event space all in one. We are invited to come in and hang out in the courtyard where we will find a plethora of bizarre objects to draw or set up into a still life. BYOB- bring your own beverage and enjoy (in moderation and in the courtyard). We will have several Sundays to work in preparation for a sidewalk exhibit right on Harvard Ave on October 25th, just in time for Halloween. (You are not required to participate in the final exhibit, but it'll be a fun reception!)


$2 towards organizer fees, $15 for art lessons/coaching during the 3 hour period.

Check out Store 54:

https://www.facebook.com/pages/Store-54/189007754475365?fref=ts


https://scontent-lga1-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xtp1/v/t1.0-9/11924244_10206835033092972_7099791323173566915_n.jpg?oh=b29c0e9641084c3d3404437fe97ba61d&oe=56A2A38A

Plenty of models who will stand stock still as long as you want.

A little of this, a little of that, every square inch is covered with something to look at, something to draw.
results.how_to_find_us: Upstairs in the Courtyard
results.name: Part Two Sketch and Show at Store 54

results.description:
This is a "low intermediate and up" level meetup. We play on grass on a men's height net. We will start with warm-up and a hitting line, followed by 6:6 play.

Low Intermediate -- players who can consistently bump, set, spike, and serve. Moderate pace; laid-back game.

Location: Grass fields at Sidney and Pacific Street in Cambridge.

Access by T: Central Square stop. Walk down Mass Ave towards MIT, make a right on Sidney Street, and walk down about four blocks to Pacific Street. It's about a 5-10 minute walk from the T stop.

Parking: There are spots on one side of Tudor Street between Sidney and Brookline that are free to park at on weekends. It is the side of the street opposite the side with the parking meters.

To make sure we have a complete game, please RSVP only if you can come, and come on time if you have RSVP'ed. Due to high demand, we are putting in place a priority rule for those who show up consistently and on time. If there is a waitlist, no-shows from the previous week get lower priority. It counts as a no-show for waitlist purposes if you change your RSVP to "no" less than 24 hours before the start time or arrive late for the actual game after warm-up.
results.name: Cambridge Outdoor Volleyball (Low Intermediate+)

results.description:
These sessions at The Chinatown Community Center/Josia School will focus on a 6 week rotating schedule of classes designed to introduce the basics of Parkour in concentrate classes. The schedule will follow in order: 

• Safety, Landings and Balance

Class 1 will be focusing on how to land, move and stay safe practicing Parkour outdoor and in the real world. 

• Vaulting

Class 2 will focus on the foundation of Parkour - getting over low-level obstacles fast and efficiently through the use of vaulting.

• Precisions

Class 3 will focus on accuracy of jumping and foot/eye coordination honing basic standing and running jumps.

• Wall Techniques 

Class 4 will focus on conquering obstacles too large or tall to vault, in tandem with using walls as a means to keep a more efficient run.

• Tumbling/Acro

Class 5 focus is on tumbling and acrobatic skills, in pursuit of fully understanding movement in a 3D space and total proprioception.

• Flow + Speed

Class 6 links together all the previous lessons into one cohesive movement, and a timed obstacle course setting.

------

What if I've never done anything like Parkour before? 


This class, Parkour 101, is a introductory level class. We will be focusing more on learning how to move our body, understand our limits and get a solid understanding of how to train safe rather than jumping straight into super-high level flips and jumps. 

What if I'm a gymnast/marine/stuntman/etc? I don't want to be bored.

Our program prides itself on scaling classes to each and every student. With something like Parkour there are many levels and progressions to each movement. It's very common to in the same class have one student working on perfecting their roll, and on the other side of the room have another student practicing very high-level acrobatics. They both come from the same foundation, but are scaled to each practitioners skill level. 

What do I need to bring/prepare?

The great thing about Parkour is its accessibility. You really only need a good pair of shoes. We recommend a shoe that is made for urban running (no aggressive treads, a smoother sole lightweight). Think hiking boots, crocs, skate shoes are all no-nos. 

Other than that, dress appropriately for activity. Shorts, sweats, t-shirts are all good here. Jeans are normally not the best choice. 

We highly recommend bringing water, snacks and a form of transportation (bike, longboard, potentially train fare)

We will be charging a $5 per class fee to start here, and for the 1 hour 15 minute class we think this isn't too ridiculous. We accept cash or card day of. 

Anything else?

These jams will be run outdoors, and with existing architecture. While we won't be getting into anything crazy, injuries are to be expected. Scrapes happen. We will have first aid available, but make sure you are thinking clearly and in your limits before training! 

I am available to answer all questions, but I hope to see a whole bunch of you out in a few weeks!! 

Be sure to check us out on:

https://www.facebook.com/ParkourAndTricking

https://instagram.com/projectfreerun


http://www.projectfreerun.com/
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be on the main courtyard up the stairs. The location itself is of concrete construction, and has yellow rails!

results.description: Hola amig@s! Nuestro parque en Cambridge está bajo construcción, y como estoy apenas saliendo de la nube de vida con un nuevo bebe, estoy organizando un picnic cerca de mi nuevo hogar en Medford. Estaré allí con la fabulosa Juniper (mi nena de 4 meses). Bienvenidos todos - traigan una comida o bebida, instrumentos de música, pelotas, juegos, niños, bebes y dos manos para ayudarme con limpiar después.  Hay bastante parqueo por la calle y es accesible por transporte publico (bus #95, #94 y estacion de West Medford en la linea de Lowell commuter rail). Anímense!
results.how_to_find_us: Estaremos bajo el techo dentro del campo de juegos O en la grama bajo los arboles!

results.description:
Class Description:


Explore questions such as:   "What kinds of meditations are there for me to try?"   "Am I doing meditation right?"  "How do I establish a foundational practice?"

This course is a great place for any beginner to start.

Also, it's a great next-step for anyone who has attended the Free Community Nights that are part of this meetup group. This course goes deeper into the nuts-and-bolts foundations of how and why to meditate.  It has more structure.

The Meditation Toolbox gives you a taste of what it means to meditate. Over the course of six weeks, this course introduces you to a number of the currently popular formats for meditation: Mindfulness, Creative Visualization, and Progressive Relaxation.

Note: we used to call this class the "The Basic Mechanics of Meditation," but the title "Meditation Toolbox" is the new name for the same program.

Six Sundays 3pm to 4:15pm.
9/20/15, 9/27/15, 10/4/15, 
(no class for Columbus Weekend 10/11) 
10/18/15, 10/25/15, 11/1/15 
11/8/15 - Reserve for snow make-up

Registration: 
Register here using meetup and pay with your credit card.  The system will automatically instruct you on how to use paypal.  The fee for all six classes is $85.

Space is limited to 25 students.  It is likely that this class will sell out.  So, please register ASAP.


The following is the detailed schedule.  
Each class will follow this schedule. 

2:45pm Arrive early.

Participants should plan to arrive by 2:45pm. This will give everyone time to settle in and find a comfortable seat. We will have the doors open early, by 2:30.  So, it's fine for you to be early.

3pm Official start time for class.
The teacher will start giving instructions for how to meditate starting exactly at 3pm.  There will be time to ask any questions you have.  We always start right on time.

3:15pm The door will be locked.
It is best to arrive right on time (3pm) or early.  Latecomers will not be allowed entry after 3:15pm. Once the meditation starts, it is too disruptive to have people come and go.

Each class includes 
a) Instructions
b) Meditation time, between 15 and 30 minutes, depending upon participant requests. 
c) Wrap-up Discussion

4:15pm - end of class.

Seating:
Our space has a number of chairs and some floor cushions you can borrow. 
Many of us will be seated on the floor. For comfort, you might want to bring a beach towel.   It's also nice to bring a water bottle for yourself.  There is a water cooler, but not cups. 

Teacher:
Gena Bean will be teaching. 

MindfulBoston's Craftsman Teachers will be assisting with this class as part of preparation for their training.
results.name: The Meditation Toolbox (Basic Mechanics) Class - Fall 2015 semester

Sunday, September 20, 2015
4 – 9 pm. at St. Catherine's of Genoa Gymnasium
179 Summer Street, Somerville, MA 02143

Brian Clement's Topic: 
‘The New Health Paradigm: Transcending Current Barriers by Focusing on the Body’s Electrical Potency’ 

Featured Speaker: Brian Clement, PhD, LN,
who has spearheaded the International Progressive Health Movement for more than three decades and is the Director of the renowned Hippocrates Health Institute, the world’s foremost complementary residential health center.

22 vendors, including

A few spots remain. 
Now $100 
(50% off regular price $200 by clicking on 
https://healthylivingexposponsor.eventbrite.com/?discount=Promo_Discount) 
for an 8 foot sales table, which includes the entrance fee for two persons. 

Public awareness organizations may display educational information on half an 8-foot table FREE.

We have an outstanding renowned International speaker, Brian Clement. Brian has spearheaded the international progressive health movement for more than three and a half decades. He is the director of the America is facing an epidemic of diabetes, cancer, obesity, malnutrition and heart disease. Research shows that many of today’s chronic diseases are completely tied to what we eat and the lifestyle choices we make. According to the Centers for Disease Control, obesity has more than doubled in children and quadrupled in adolescents in the past 30 years.

The Real Kids Real Food (RKRF) after-school program for inner-city kidsprovides a solution to this epidemic - one child at a time!  Together, with your help, we can change these statistics.

Real Kids Real Food (RKRF) is changing children’s lives through hands-on preparation of real nutritious meals (probably the healthiest they will eat all week).  RKRF incorporates not only food, but an exercise program to help prevent obesity, chronic disease and malnutrition.  RKRF was created by Optimum Health Solution (501c3), a non-profit organization which provides education and advocacy of healthy living.

Real Kids Real Food (RKRF) children learn the importance of organic and local foods and the true value of a meal with its full life force as intended by nature. They are encouraged to read labels of processed foods and to make better choices of unprocessed and raw foods to nourish their bodies with adequate fiber and natural enzymes. Parents are also educated as part of this program. One of the parents of RKRF, trained by our organization, is launching Familia Saludable for Spanish-speaking parents. Our larger goal is to encourage change in their lifestyles by building better habits such as reading, exercise, self-care and gardening, which will enable them to love fresh foods. We are very excited to announce that an e-book is currently being created to offer RKRF in many more communities. 

We need your help to raise funds and public awareness to launch this program at the Healey public school in Somerville. $100 provides food, materials and staff for 20 children for one week.

You can help by donating $100  (50% off regular price by clicking on https://healthylivingexposponsor.eventbrite.com/?discount=Promo_Discount) for an 8 foot sales table which includes the entrance fee for two people.  Public awareness organizations may display educational information on half an 8 foot table FREE at Optimum Health Solution’s upcoming Healthy Living Expo on Sunday, September 20th, from  4 - 9 pm at St. Catherine’s gymnasium, 179 Summer Street, Somerville. We are exceedingly grateful to St. Catherine of Genoa Parish for its generous donation of its gymnasium for this fund-raiser. We wish for this to be an event where all parties benefit - a win-win situation.

To have one of the 22 tables, email the completed attached contract as soon as possible. Email or call me if you have any questions.

results.description:
That's right...our next meetup is...

Another GARAGEBOX - Parking Garage Reverb Beatbox Session!!!

Due to popular demand, this is now a monthly meetup!!  Sorry for the short notice on this particular one...it's tomorrow!

I discovered this place recently, and it's a spacious parking garage with amazing reverb.  This is no ordinary reverb.  I'm talking one-kick-drum-sound-breaks-the-glass-in-the-windows type reverb.  Seriously...this place is nuts!  I was up in this joint blasting beats for hours the other day!  You WON'T be disappointed with the sound in this place.  Even if you generally make rather quiet sounds, the reverb in this place will set your beats on fire!  No microphone needed.  

...and the best part?  There's a chill, super-classy rooftop garden to chill at once your lungs can't take any more beats!

...and the next best part?  There are hip bars all around to grab beers after a heavy session of beat-banging!  Bring your ID if you plan to get drinks.  Most places are sports-bars, so under 21 is also welcome; you can get food!

Here's the plan:

1.  Meetup, test out the sound in this amazing parking garage.

2.  Each person shares a 2-minute showcase.

3.  Beatbox Q & A:  Each person describes a beatboxing sound, issue, or asks a question.

4.  Collaboration time!

Make sure your RSVP all of your friends who you're bringing so we have an accurate count.

See you there!

-GREEN
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be right before you head up to the rooftop garden.  Exit Kendall station, follow the "COOP" signs, and then enter the place where it says "Rooftop Garden" and you'll see us.
results.name: Come to GARAGEBOX:  The only parking garage beatbox session!

results.description:
Come join Cambridge residents and business owners in an open and casual environment to discuss your questions, concerns suggestions and vision for Cambridge and its government.

All are welcome and there is no agenda. This event is free and is taking place at Grafton Street Pub & Grill. There is a cash bar if you would like to order food or drink.

These Round Table events are organized by Kim Courtney and Xavier Dietrich, two Cambridge residents who are candidates for City Council. From their experience, there are not enough venues and opportunities to voice questions and concerns about the City and its operation, and they are interested in hearing from everyone who would like to share their perspective.

Please be on time since this meeting is only one hour.  This meeting is limited to 20 people so that everyone can contribute. Since space is limited, please only sign up if you can join us, and cancel if something comes up.
results.name: Round Table - Share Questions & Concerns about Cambridge City Government

results.description:
Hello ASL Enthusiasts!

WHAT: ASL Weekly Social
WHEN: EVERY SUNDAY 
TIME: 4:00-6:00PM
WHO: ANYONE is welcome to come by and have a conversation in ASL
WHY: To socialize, have fun, and enjoy chatting in ASL
WHERE: Tavern in the Square in Porter Square

NOTE: Every once a while, the location may change. PLEASE look on the website each week for confirmation. THANKS!


To get to the Meetup, take the RED LINE stop OUTBOUND TO ALEWIFE, and stop at PORTER SQ. Look down the street. There's Tavern in the Square! If you're driving, you can park on the street for free on Sundays!

Anyone who loves ASL is welcome to come and be part of the fun! We want to warmly extend an invitation to Deaf people or others fluent/skilled in the language (CODAs for example) to join our group.

This is an easy-going, casual, ASL get-together to meet people who enjoy American Sign Language, who want to brush up on their signing skills, and want to learn more ASL by using it as often as possible.

We strive to have a good time and communicate without using voices. If we need to, we draw or write what we don't know how to sign, and if lots of folks show up, we split up into small groups and mix and mingle, so we can actually see one another clearly, face-to-face and get a good conversation going.

Don't be afraid or shy if you're not "perfect" at ASL, because being "perfect" is not the point of this group. No one expects that everyone will be at the same level, and none of us mind slowing down or repeating what we have signed so that everyone understands.

We all laugh WITH one another as we fumble along, mess things up, and start over again. This isn't an ASL class, since none of us are certified ASL teachers, so there's really no pressure or expectation--other than that we all use ASL to communicate. We all learn from one another!

IF you've taken an ASL/Sign Language class before (or have had exposure to someone who uses the language) and know the basics (alphabet, numbers 1-20, and even a small vocabulary of signs ), then join us to get your fingers, hands, face and body moving, ASL-style!

IF you haven't taken an ASL class, or don't know the basics, don't be discouraged ... you can come along anyway and learn by watching, and gradually, participating. We have lots of resources that we can suggest for learning ASL from a qualified teacher or authentic source, such as books, online classes, and local classes at various locations near Boston.

If you can, "officially" RSVP, even if the RSVP is "No," so that we know who is definitely going to come.

It will be great to see folks!

Erika and Jack
results.how_to_find_us: We will be there signing our beautiful language to inspire all of you!

results.description:
Its been a great summer walking all around Massachusetts.  Lets walk together along the beach on the last Sunday of Summer 2015 and then grab food/drinks!  

--We will start at Savin Hill and connect to the Dorchester's Harborwalk, which goes around UMass Boston and Old Harbor Park.  Then, we will continue on the Carson Beach walkway and end at Castle Island. Take a lap there and break.


--Then by 630pm, those that are interested, we will walk to Coppersmith to get dinner and drinks.  Its a cool new restaurant/cafe that just opened.

*Total walking is about 8miles. (5miles from Savin Hill to Castle Island + 1mile Castle Island + 2miles Castle Island to Coppersmith)

*Wear good walking shoes and dress in casual clothes. 

*I will try to make reservations at Coppersmith.

Looking forward to our Fall 2015 meetups!

results.description:
Give yourself the gift of relaxation and rejuvenation with a wonderful 90 minute gentle yoga and meditation class.

True relaxation is experienced by the body and mind when little or no energy is consumed. It is Nature's way of recharging. Since every action, conscious or unconscious, uses stored energy, relaxation is necessary for good health and peace of mind. Without proper relaxation the body and mind become overworked and inefficient.

When the mind is constantly bombarded by stimuli, it becomes overloaded and exhausted. We may be unaware that we are doing it, but by thinking and worrying we are using up tremendous amounts of energy. The tension put on the mind by worries can use more energy than physical work.

Yoga retrains the body to relax and can calm the mind which leads to inner peace.

This class is for beginners and experienced yogi's.  Chairs are available for those who may need to sit during this class.  Please bring your own yoga mat, water and a blanket or pillow for meditation.
results.name: Gentle Yoga & Meditation - 90 minute class

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$24 (MUST register with code ATWYS- codes can not be applied after registration)

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: 

https://2015bostonatwysspeeddating.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS. NO EXCEPTIONS.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

PLEASE REMEMBER:
* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.
results.name: Speeddating Ages 33-45  - SOLD OUT FOR WOMEN

results.description:
{Enhance your communication skills for closer relationship.   Relationship counselor Michal Kenny will help you to better communicate with any partner -- current or future. Learn the principles of effective communication and explore your strengths and weaknesses.}


Our Topic This Evening Will ....

... give you specific techniques that you can use to help someone you love to open up to share what they really think, and to help them to hear more clearly what you have to say.

You will:
- Re-emphasize communication as a reciprocal process
- Learn how to affect the tone of conversation
- Learn how to generate communication
- Learn how to respond in ways that help you deliver your message
- Learn how to allow your partner to open up

Partners complain, "My partner just doesn't tell me what is going on!"  What if there were ways that you could help your partner get more in touch with his/her feelings, and express them to you?

We'll practice ...

And, what you can do when you really want your partner to hear you?


This session is for anyone in relationship or wanting to be in relationship.  It is not necessary to have your partner present, or even to have a partner.  And of course, partners are welcome.

To Prepare ....

1. Think of a recent time when an important communication was derailed.   What abilities might have helped this communication go more smoothly?

2. What have you noticed about your ability to communicate over your lifetime?   Which aspects of your communication serve you? Which aspects of your communication get in your way?

Our Leader This Evening

https://fbcdn-profile-a.akamaihd.net/hprofile-ak-ash2/v/t1.0-1/c36.29.358.358/s160x160/252109_2192779534158_3291179_n.jpg?oh=b6c15d0d9c9753f538983f84136bdb68&oe=565B8A21&__gda__=1443870575_82b930190ec685db9bbb4254043e5e6a

Relationship counselor, Michal Kenny, works with couples who have difficulty communicating.  Oftentimes, they have reached an impasse, and may have even harmed their relationship through miscommunication.  Michal is interested in helping couples -- before the moment of crisis -- to learn how to communicate more clearly, in a win-win situation.  And, only one member of the couple need to know these techniques for progress to be made.....

Links

Most Important:   
  * Other, Upcoming Heartbeat Salons. 
  * Join our Heart Conversation on FaceBook

For Newbies: 
  *  What is a Heartbeat Salon?  
  *  Where are Heartbeat Salons  
  *  Guidelines for Attending a Heartbeat Salon .

For Potential Hosts: 
  * How to Host a Heartbeat Salon . 
  * Topics to Offer at a Heartbeat Salon .

For Potential Presenters: 
  * How to Present at a Heartbeat Salon .

Your Suggestions: 
  * Give Us Your Ideas (topics, locations, etc) .

venue.address_1: Aberdeen Ave & Huron Ave, Cambridge, MA 02138
venue.name: Aberdeen Ave & Huron Ave, Cambridge, MA 02138

results.description:
Let's join 20+ others from six other walking groups for:

Since May 2012, there has been a regular walk around Fresh Pond at about an hour before sunset. Frequently, 20-25 walkers turn out for this walk, and you can too. There are a whole bunch of regulars, along with some new people.

We'll go out to dinner at a local pub or chinese restaurant - you can get a decent dinner for under $10.

Frequently, if we eat too much food, we'll go for another walk.

Come see why this walk is so popular. It's at a great time, the people are friendly, the parking is free -- no permit parking in Cambridge on Sunday, so you can park on Huron or Aberdeen Ave.

You can get there by T easily from Harvard Square, take the 71 OR 73 bus to Aberdeen Ave, then walk to the other end of Aberdeen Ave, and you'll see us there. We'll be next to the bridge, on the pond side of Huron Ave,at the intersection of Aberdeen Ave.

If you're late, and we've already started, start walking counter-clockwise. We'll be walking clockwise, so we'll surely bump into each other. We're the large group of vigorously chatting walkers.

Hope to see you there.

Shangri La is located at 149 Belmont Street, Belmont - please let the host know if you're coming, so we can get the right sized table.
results.name: Large,Multigroup Weekly Walk around Fresh Pond,dinner @ Shangri-La :9/20@5:30

results.description:
Let's join five other walking groups and 20+ walkers for this walk.  Walk is on, Rain or Shine.

Few things are more enjoyable than a nice walk and a chat at the end of a busy weekend.

Since May 2012, we've met with a few other meetup groups Let's join for a stroll in a beautiful setting.

We walk clockwise, so if you get there late, just start walking counter-clockwise and you'll run into us.

Parking on Huron Avenue is easy, since the "Permit Parking" rules don't apply on Sunday - just park in any spot on Huron Ave, there will be plenty of them.

If you're coming by bus, take the 71 or 73 bus from Harvard Square and get off at Aberdeen Ave. Walk all the way up Aberdeen until you come to Huron Avenue, we'll be there.

Afterwards, we'll go out for dinner. We usually go for some unusual Chinese food, and the total cost is about $10 per person.

If you have trouble finding us, call me at[masked]

results.name: Sunday Night @ Pandemonium

results.description:
"How much better is silence; the coffee cup, the table. How much better to sit by myself like the solitary sea-bird that opens its wings on the stake. Let me sit here for ever with bare things, this coffee cup, this knife, this fork, things in themselves, myself being myself.” --from The Waves

The Waves is often regarded as Virginia Woolf's masterpiece, standing with those few works of twentieth-century literature that have created unique forms of their own. In deeply poetic prose, Woolf traces the lives of six children from infancy to death who fleetingly unite around the unseen figure of a seventh child, Percival. Allusive and mysterious, The Waves yields new treasures upon each reading.
results.name: Woolf:  The Waves

group.name: Classic Books: A Book Club for Voracious Readers

results.description:
The time has been extended for this sale - it will now run from 6:00 PM to 9:00 PM. If you plan to attend please be sure to RSVP so that they know how many people to expect.

If you are looking for ideas of what you might need you can visit the various gear lists that we have posted on the group's page:

http://www.meetup.com/random-hikers/files/


==========

Last year we entered into a sponsorship arrangement with Eastern Mountain Sports and it's time for our Private Sales Event. As you know, they are headquartered right here in New England and carry much of the apparel, footwear and gear that we all use during our daily adventures!

Don’t miss the EMS First Tracks Private Sale EXCLUSIVELY for members of the Random Group of Hikers and a couple of other Meetup Groups in the area. The sale is Sunday, September 20th from 6:00 pm - 8:00 pm in their Newton Store, which is located at 300 Needham Street in Newton MA. 

During the Private Sale, we will all be treated to an exclusive, special offer of 20% off storewide (there will be limited restrictions). EMS will have representativeson site doing clinics and hosting raffles and store guides will help you with personalized shopping. This will be an incredible way to gear up for the fall and winter season!

Please RSVP so we know how many to expect and can help EMS plan logistics.
results.name: Private Sale at EMS

Sign-up link for the webinar is here: https://www.innerengineering.com/online/webinars?signinsrc=Meetup-NewEngland

***REGISTRATION closes 45 minutes prior to the webcast.***  Please make sure you sign-up on our website at least 45 mins prior to the webcast to receive your live log-in link via email.


(Technical Support: <a>[masked]</a>)


The Inner Engineering online program includes guided meditations, powerful breathing techniques, and deeply engaging discourses about the nature of the mind and practical wisdom to manage life’s situations.

Inner Engineering is a combination of methods derived from the ancient science of yoga that addresses every aspect of human well-being — from your body, mind and emotions to the essential life energy within.

This 1 hour introduction to Inner Engineering explains the fundamental approach of the program in a live setting that offers you the opportunity to ask a trained Isha teacher questions about the program and practices available.

“Inner Engineering is neither a religion, nor a philosophy or dogma; It is a technology for wellbeing. One does not have to believe or disbelieve, you just have to learn to use it. Technology will produce results irrespective of who you are.” – Sadhguru
results.name: An Introduction to Inner Engineering--FREE Class (Online Webinar)

20% OFF of Total Purchase, including full-price, sale, and clearance merchandise. The following limited exclusions apply: Bikes (current season), boats, racks, SUP, GPS, electronics, and cameras. This discount cannot be applied to prior purchases, or to the purchase of gift cards.

results.description:
If you missed the last Private Sale at EMS, don’t worry!

Here is another awesome opportunity for our members to SAVE while we all GEAR up for spring.

Check out the EMS Club Day event at the Harvard Square EMS Store on September 20th at 6 PM

EMS is offering a 20% storewide discount on regular priced items, with limited exclusions.  EMS is celebrating those who are out there enjoying outdoor activities, providing outdoor recreational opportunities, and protecting our precious outdoor resources.

EMS would like to thank our group for being a valued member of the EMS family. I hope to see you there

Please RSVP so we know how many to expect and can help EMS plan logistics.

results.description:
Calling all teacher types! And that's whether it's at a school with kids, a university setting, or in life when you have to explain things to adults (e.g. pointy haired engineering managers) that don't understand them. And specifically, today's lesson is the teaching of math concepts. Everything from counting to algebra to calculus and beyond. What works and what doesn't? Is new math or new new math better or worse than the way Grandma did it? Should people memorize things like multiplication tables and trig identities, or should you teach the ideas and let the mental maps take care of themselves? How much abstraction can kids (or adults for that matter) handle? Is the academic world going to hell in a handbasket according to yet another middle aged generation? Join us in a fun and lively discussion of the teaching and learning of 'rithmetic.

Hope to see you there  (and don't be squared).
results.name: The Teaching and Learning of Math

results.description:
This play has everything: incest, patricide, and the most crushing anagnorisis in dramatic history. Not to mention the prophetically cranky, blindly perceptive Old Man Tiresias.  

It's also very short and absolutely gripping. 

Read it here: https://records.viu.ca/~johnstoi/sophocles/oedipustheking.htm


Buy it here (and get two bonus plays for free): http://www.amazon.com/Three-Theban-Plays-Antigone-Oedipus/dp/0140444254/ref=sr_1_3?ie=UTF8&qid=1441750893&sr=8-3 

Check out the original ancient Greek here: http://www.perseus.tufts.edu/hopper/text?doc=Perseus%3Atext%3A1999.01.0191


Watch it in that stiff 1950s style of acting here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZZUCgq8LfhY

I won't cancel this meetup, even if all but two of you cancel at the last minute (I've re-thought this policy, and of course it's not fair to those of you who've done the reading and made room on your calendar). But please don't RSVP until you're relatively sure you can make it.
results.name: Sophocles' "Oedipus The King"

results.description:
It's week 3 of the 2015 Liquid Courage Comedy Club at Somerville Brewing. FREE: The comedy club experience is called the Liquid Courage Comedy Club at Somerville Brewing Company. The brewery and destination-taproom, which opened in April of 2105, opens Sunday nights as a showcase style stand-up comedy club open to the public 21+ with no cover charge or ticket fee. Guests are able to order charcuterie boards, dinner and pints during, before and after the show. With a Sunday night show time of 9PM there is ample free parking is available.

Season 1, the 2015 dates are as follows: September 13th, 20th and 27th, October 4th, 11th and 25th, November 1st 8th 15th and 22nd December 6th 13th 20th and 27th.

The opening night on September 6th filled to capacity and guests were entertained by 7 professional comedians and show host C.J. Browne. “We’re excited to offer a curated show of experienced local comedians. Since the room and setup require excellence the showcase is not an open mic night. We are absolutely psyched about the success of opening night. We played to a full house that loved the show.” Show performer Gary Peterson says “The Slumbrew comedy show was such a fun room to work, because the owners care about making it fun. A packed house of young heroes supporting the local scene makes this place special. It makes me happy to know something so cool is alive in Somerville.”
results.name: Liquid Courage Comedy Club At Slumbrew

results.description:
YOU MUST REGISTER ON WebEx TO ATTEND.

All attendees will receive the white paper, "Transforming Customer Engagement Using WebRTC APIs and Frameworks," written by business technology analyst Brent Kelly.

WebRTC is an emerging communications standard available on billions of PCs, smartphones, and tablets. It enables real-time voice, video and data sharing in a Web browser without the need for browser plugins or downloads. When WebRTC-enabled applications are coupled with contact centers, customer engagement can be transformed because customers and prospects can communicate with a contact center agent via voice or video from within the context of browsing a web page or from within a dedicated mobile app. This user context can accompany the call to the contact center agent, thus giving agents more information about a user intent, which allows the agent to satisfy the user’s needs faster and better.

Join business communication and technology expert analyst Brent Kelly of KelCor, Inc. and Plantronics Vice President of Innovation and New Ventures, Cary Bran as they discuss how organizations can rapidly develop and deploy WebRTC-enabled applications using WebRTC APIs.

Brent Kelly

Brent Kelly is Principal Analyst at KelCor, Inc. where he focuses on business communications processes and technologies. Dr. Kelly provides strategy and counsel to Chief Information Officers, Chief Technology Officers, investment analysts, VCs, technology policy executives, sell side firms and technology buyers. He has been an independent consultant and analyst 15 years, writing hundreds of articles and presenting at numerous public and private events. Dr. Kelly has served as the CEO of a privately held manufacturing company, and prior to this, he was part of the team at Schlumberger that built the devices Intel used to test Pentium microprocessors. He also led teams developing real-time data acquisition and control systems, and adaptive intelligent design systems in several Schlumberger Oil Field services companies including four years of R&D experience in Europe. He has a Ph.D. in engineering from Texas A&M University and a B.S. in engineering from Brigham Young University. Dr. Kelly is serving in his second term as an elected official in his community.

Cary Bran

Cary Bran serves as Vice President of Innovation and New Ventures at Plantronics. In this role, Cary leads the research and development of next generation software and device concepts and products, including efforts to deliver integrations between wearable devices and web browsers via WebRTC. Cary is also responsible for leading PLT Labs, a multi-disciplinary team within Plantronics that is working to identify and develop advanced wearable technologies that can be leveraged by developers to create new wearable tech-based applications.

Cary’s background includes more than sixteen years of experience developing enterprise collaboration and communications software solutions. Prior to joining Plantronics, Cary was at Cisco Systems for more than a decade, where he held positions in software architecture, business development and technical strategy. As part of his tenure at Cisco he led the internal WebRTC evangelism efforts and contributed to the IETF and W3C WebRTC standards development.

Cary holds a BS (Cum Laude) in Computer Science from Seattle University and an MBA from the Foster School of Business at the University of Washington.
results.name: Transforming Customer Engagement Using WebRTC APIs

results.description:
NUTSHELL - every week day, 12:15ish until 1:45ish, Cumnock Turf Fields at Harvard Stadium, games of 4v4 up to 10v10 or larger depending on who shows, bring a white shirt and a dark/colored shirt (but not a gray one), almost never canceled, read below for more details before asking questions that are answered here, and read the comments for today's meetup to see if there is anything important about today.

http://goo.gl/I0tPQQ

GETTING THERE BY PUBLIC TRANSPORT - Harvard Square is the closest T stop (red line).  Check Google Maps or other to find fastest way there from wherever you are.

GETTING THERE BY RIDE SHARE - a lot of players in this meetup come by car and are nice enough to offer rides to others. Best hope of getting a ride is leaving a comment here asking if anybody is driving and willing to pick you up.

PARKING - you must park at one of the metered spots if you park on Harvard property near the stadium.  They will patrol for cars parked illegally.

COST - free while we play outdoors.

ATTIRE - Bring a *white* shirt and a dark/vivid color shirt so we can easily divide into teams.  DO NOT BRING A GRAY SHIRT- you will annoy a lot of people if you do. Turf shoes or cleats recommended, and sneakers are fine.  Shin-guards optional- most people don't wear them. Bring a ball if you have one.

RSVP and CANCELING - the sooner you RSVP, the better.  That said, most people don't RSVP until around 10:30am the day of the meetup, so we make the call around 11:15am the day of the meetup about whether a game needs to be canceled.  Check here right before heading over.

ETIQUETTE - we have A LOT of players in this meetup and play every (week)day. Each day is a different mix of people, skill levels, and attitudes.  Most people playing do this for fun and/or exercise in the middle of the day.  Please respect this by at least following these unspoken rules that we have:

1) You may not hurt anybody- especially yourself. All of us just want to safely return to the office/class afterward.

2) Do not yell at, criticize, or offer unsolicited "tips" to other players unless they ask for your opinion. It ruins an otherwise fun, all-skill-levels game. If you do this often, you may be asked to find another meetup.

3) Be the first to get the ball if it goes out of bounds. Especially if you kicked it last or are the closest one to the ball. 

4) Fighting is prohibited. We've never come close to having a problem with this, but better stated aloud. If it gets physical, we may call the police as it becomes a felony/legal matter.

WHAT ELSE - All skill levels welcome- it's a big mix. While these are general guidelines, always read the comments section for the latest updates for today's meetup.

results.description:
Join us for dinner and a presentation about Building Your Business Through Referrals by Paul Hutchinson.

Is there a way to succeed in business without really “selling”? Yes. It’s called referral-based marketing. Paul Hutchinson is a master at it, and if you attend this presentation, you’ll be on your way to mastery, too. Paul will help us with a problem many of us face: Independent consultants and other solo professionals often find “selling” the thing they least like to do. But the essence of being in business for yourself – “on your own,” as they say – is taking responsibility for bringing in new work. Paul will talk us through questions you may have about building your business or practice through referrals. He will also show each of us how to create a detailed individual plan for generating more and better referrals. We’ll learn ways to harvest the sources we already have to build referrals. If you’re already getting most of your business by referrals, Paul will show you how to step up your game with his systematic approach.

The cost is $50 for members and first time attendees. All others are $55. Late registration for members is $60 and $65 for all others.

Please remember to pay for the meeting online at http://www.spconsultants.org/event-2012043 or bring a cash or check to the event.

This month, we'll be moving the time and location of our regular monthly social event to coincide with a sustainable urban living event, hosted by Green City Growers in Somerville. One of the featured speakers will be award-winning author William Powers, who some of you might recognize as the author of Twelve by Twelve: A One-Room Cabin Off the Grid and Beyond the American Dream.

It's a ticketed event, but we've been offered the chance to attend for free. Please only RSVP if you can make it, though! They're looking for an accurate head count. Let us know if you have any questions! It should be a very interesting event and discussion.

Event title:

Fresh Ideas for Sustainable Urban Living: Inspired by New Slow City and BostonEco

Event description:

Join us for an inspiring presentation and conversation meant for anyone trying to make urban life more people and planet-friendly. The discussion will be led by award-winning author William Powers (New Slow City: Living Simply in the World's Fastest City and Twelve by Twelve), author Ali Berlow (The Food Activist Handbook), Augusta Nichols-Even (Green City Growers), and moderatorJanet Morgenstern Passani (founder of BostonEco), as they explore questions – and answers – critical to our happiness and health as urban inhabitants. The event is co-sponsored by NetImpact and presented by Jute Marketing.

Date and Time:

Monday, Sept 21 from 6pm to 8pm(Refreshments and mingling at 6pm; program starts at 6:30pm; book signing and mingling will follow the discussion around 7:30pm)

Venue:

Green City Growers - 600 Windsor Place, Somerville, MA 02143
results.name: Sustainable Urban Living Talk with William Powers and Monthly Social

What the experience of drumming offers:

* A peak experience that bonds all who share it
* An atmosphere of truth, support, and harmony
* Techniques to reduce tension, worry, and stress
* A tribal celebration in an indigenous tradition
* Open heart and mind to awareness of spirit.

Mamadou teaches the importance of the drum in the African culture to the community as a mode of communication and in the daily life.

West african drumming is not just music, but an experience of the heart, mind, and spirit. It evokes self-discovery, spiritual renewal, joy for life, and a deep sense of community.

Each class is $10 per person.
results.why:
Mamadou has been teaching African drum in the North Shore area for over 10 years. He has an inherent talent for sharing his abilities with others. Let him teach you how to feel the rhythms of West Africa.

Plus, its a lot of fun :)

results.description:
Please join us for networking and a discussion on September 21st, with Paul Hayre, Founder of Sano.  Sano is pioneering a disposable, low cost, point-of-care diagnostic platform focused on chronic wounds, such as diabetic foot ulcers and pressure ulcers. Sano's device measures wound biochemistry to personalize treatment, promote faster healing, and reduce treatment costs.  

Paul launched Sano after watching how his father's chronic pressure ulcer was treated day in and day out: simple dressing changes, never healing. That protocol is largely the standard of care in the US today. His goal is to give clinicians visibility into wound biochemistry to determine effective treatments.  

Refreshments provided by Helbling (6pm-8pm).

Agenda:
6:00-6:30 Refreshments (Swiss Bakers) and Networking
6:30-7:30 Paul Hayre, Intro and Q&A  
7:30-8:00 Networking 

Then join us for the afterparty at Firebrand Saints!
results.name: Bringing Science to the Art of Wound Healing

Couch to 5K Fall Group
Interested in getting in shape but don’t know where to begin? Want to meet s

We have 2 groups:

1. Our Jogging Group has a goal of jogging a 5K.
2. Our Alumni Jogging Group has a goal of keep jogging for those who have jogged at least once season with us.

We introduce people to jogging and getting fit. The program gradually moves you from walking at your own pace to jogging at your own pace.

• FREE 10-week program to get you from the couch to running a 5K (3.1 miles) 

• Anyone from the community can participate

• Led by experienced runners

• Monday through Thursdays 6pm-6:45pm; Sundays 8am-8:45am, with a goal of joining us 3 of these sessions per week.

• 45 minute time commitment

• Goal of jogging and finishing the Stow Gobbler on Thanksgiving morning.

Encourage those you love to get “off the couch” and join you in the great sport of running. Come have some fun! Bring a water bottle and join the group.

Please consult your doctor if you have a health or medical condition that prevents you from exercising.

For more information please visit http://www.connectingpointchurch.org/couchto5k/

results.description:
We are bringing back our regular "HackNight" (formerly hackfest) event! Are you ready? 


Bring any Android project, wether you are currently working on side project as a hobby, a new startup idea, or just getting started on some tuts, and interested in learning more about Android in general! This is a good way to learn among your peers, network, meet some new people, get some help or feedback, and collaborate on a project together. So bring your energy, passion to learn, and most importantly bring your selves...

The event will be graciously sponsored, and hosted by Raizlabs..

Raizlabs is not new to mobile, and have been around since 2003, getting started right here in Boston. They have worked to build a reputation for one of the premiere mobile shops in Boston. 100 launches later, Raizlabs currently has locations both in San Francisco (2013), and Boston. Previously Raizlabs was located in Coolidge Corner, than downtown Boston as 2012, and recently expanded to a larger venue earlier this year. If you have not checked out the space, this your chance, it really is a great space. We are are thankful to Raizlabs for sponsoring, and hosting our next event!

Agenda:

6:00p-6:30p- Doors open, networking, pizza, and beverages provided. Brief welcome, announcements, and getting started with HackNight. 

6:30p-7:00p-Android QuickTalks: This will take place in a separate room for anyone interested in dropping in, for those interested on hacking on projects this will take place in a separate space. Each presenter will have 10 minutes to cover any Android topic/project they are working on (no slide-deck needed). 


1.) Steve Doroff- Will talk about work being done with a doctor to integrate FDA approved bio-medical device with mobile, to capture sensor, patient event data for analysis, and proactive feedback..

2.) Ilya Tsymbal- App permissions in Marshmellow are changing from static install-time grant to dynamic use-time request. There is now a number of things to check for, does my app have the permissions it needs when it needs them? Should I request them? Should I show rationale for requesting them, or should I send the user to the settings to enable them?

3.) Still have room for one more QuickTalk. Is there a hot Android topic you are dying to talk about? This could be you! :O) 

7:30p-7:45p- Q&A session: we will have an on open group discussion with any problems you might be stuck on, and leave it up to the group to try come up with a solution or at least point you in the right direction..

7:45p-9p- Continue hacking, brief stretch around 8:30ish (everybody stand-up), and closing words..

Cost: $25

Arrive early for some socializing and enjoy some Beer, Wine and Hors D’oeuvres prior to the workshop at 7:00pm. There will be time to Mix & Mingle afterwards as well.

Join Relationship coach Deborah Knight (coachdeborahknight.com) and Profile Photographer Jon Fischer (thebeautyofyou.com) to learn how to leverage the Law of Attraction to get the most out of your online dating experience and find the right partner for you. The Laws of Attraction are always working in our lives. Why not use them to your advantage? If you're not familiar with the law of attraction, Deborah will give a very brief overview but it might be better to google it a bit before you come. 

Maybe you’re thinking that you’re too old, too heavy, or too ...something.  Deborah will teach you why these thoughts are in the way of you finding love and how to easily shift out of that. 

On-line Dating has become one of the easiest ways to meet someone so how do you use the Law of Attraction so that you not only are successful but enjoy the process? 

Believe it or not you will learn how to prepare yourself before you even click on Match.com or OK cupid.  Why not have the law of attraction a part of the whole process: From "checking out" the options; writing that first "hello"; responding to that inquiry; getting a "no thank you" note; even the first date. Deborah will show you how to do it all with an abundance mentality so that you have more success and actually have fun in the process. 

How do you show up in your pictures using the Law of Attraction as your guide? Jon is a professional photographer who specializes in online dating profile photos and and he will give you some thoughts on how using The Law of Attraction while getting your photo taking will make those images amazing and be a lightning rod to attract others. 

Join us on Monday September 21 @ 6:30 pm to find out once and for all what the Law of Attraction has to do with your love life anyway!

For important directions and parking info click here: http://thebeautyofyou.com/parking-2/
results.name: Using the Law of Attraction w/Online Dating to find a great love in your life

results.description:
Indoor Rock Gym:  Central Rock Gym Watertown Ma (Monday's)

This Meetup is for weekly climbing at the Central Rock Gym in Watertown, MA. This meetup is intended to provide climbing partners for both lead and top rope climbers that sign up for the meetups.

Meet by the cubbies facing the Lead Wall (they will be on the right as you enter). I (Lovey) am usually wearing a teal harness with green & black climbing shoes.  Climb for 1.5 to 3 hrs. Adults of all skill levels and ages welcomed.  

**If you are leading, you should have your own rope. Work it out with your partner as to whose rope you'll be using if only one rope will be used between the two of you. Sometimes lead climbers prefer to lead on their own rope so both lead climbers may bring their own ropes to use. Word of caution: other climbers may help themselves to the second rope when it's not in use.


**If you come late, come find me or ask the CRG staff for help.  They know we climb on Mondays and can help you find the group. 

**There is another meetup group (and perhaps a second) that also climbs Watertown Mondays nights. If you miss the RSVP deadline, would appreciate a courtesy email/call to let me know you'll be joining us so I know to expect you.


**You are required to fill out the rock gym waivers. Go to their website http://www.centralrockgym.com/watertown.php and fill out their Liability Waiver online to save time when you arrive at the gym. 

**It is your responsibility to make sure you have taken the CRG Belay and/or Lead tests. If you have never climbed at CRG, you will be required to take their Belay test given by their staff only. Please make certain to come a bit early to allow for time to take their belay test.

**If you have never belayed before, please make sure to take the "Intro Belay Class". You can sign up for this class (http://www.centralrockgym.com/bookeo.php?s=watertown under "Climbing Instruction).

**If you are interested in taking their Intro To Leading Climbing class, you can sign up for it at (http://www.centralrockgym.com/bookeo.php?s=watertown under "Climbing Instruction).

Equipment required: harness, shoes, chalk and belay device. 


Day Passes - $20 (Student/Military: $16)

10-Day Punch card $180 (Student/Military: $144)


Gear Rental:

- $8 Full Package

- $5 Harness

- $5 Shoes

- $2 Chalk

- $2 Belay Device

Membership options and further details are available on the website:http://www.centralrockgym.com/watertown.php

=============================================

Waiver:  Read !!!

Be Warned!

Mountaineering, Skiing – Alpine or Back Country, Rock & Ice Climbing by its very nature is an extremely hazardous activity.

Falling off any part of an climbing route or bouldering challenge or other associated activities, even hiking to a destination may result in injury or death. Weather, Trail conditions be it a slip on a trail or falling objects like rocks, climbing gear or tree’s from above, or avalanche can all incur injuries and/or death. 

Any information on this Meetup group page is for the basic understanding of what could be encountered. We do not guarantee any type of accuracy on this information. Seek your own additional resources of information.  You as an active member! Perhaps, lacking any of the following: professional training, good judgment, moral character or a conscience. We or anyone on any Meetup-Mountaineers cannot be held responsible in anyway.

When arriving at any Meetup you should always use your own best judgment. You must decide whether or not the conditions “ both physical or mental” are in your best interests. 

You cannot blame the organizer(s) if you get hurt. To join this meetup event you must acknowledge that you have read this waiver and thereby you completely and totally agree to indemnify the organizer(s) from any possible legal action related to any type of illness, injury, loss of equipment etc. that might potentially occur. We are not guides or leaders in any event held. Just the organizers of finding a meeting location that people with similar interests can meet and socialize.

That said have fun! Play safely! And take the responsibility of your own actions.


The Organizers…
